channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Major pothole towards middle of the road that almost threw me of my bike when travelling at speed, 17th July
item.description:
Pothole is near the middle of the road but on the left hand side when travelling down the hill. Pothole is in the section of the road with trees on both sides and is very difficult for cyclists to see or avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian view obstruction, 17th July
item.description:
The view from crossing from Tommy Taylor’s Lane into Pittville Park is completely obscured by an over grown verge. Pedestrians have to lean into the on coming traffic to see if it’s safe to cross. I have already reported this as a hazard and nothing has been done about it. Many children use this point to cross and it’s a section of the road that vehicles tend to speed up. Please do not ignore this request as it is a danger and needs to be dealt with asap. This has been an issue for 3 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tommy Taylors Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole directly in the wheel tracks of passing vehicles, 17th July
item.description:
Deep, square pothole on the northern side of the road adjacent to the verge bank that is directly in the wheel tracks of vehicles (the road is effectively single lane at this point and it is difficult to avoid hitting it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a deep pothole on Beaufort Road at junction with Oakhurst Rise, 17th July
item.description:
There is a deep pothole on Beaufort Road at junction with Oakhurst Rise. There are a couple of blobs of white paint close to it but no reports that a pothole in this location is due to be fixed. It appears to have been missed when I recently reported it along with a couple of other potholes requiring repair in this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Beaufort Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing stop lines on approach to junction, 17th July
item.description:
The road surface has been re-laid at the northern side of the cross-roads but the stop lines (on the side of the road travelling from Upper Dowdeswell towards the A436) have not been relaid. This means that there is a risk someone might drive across the junction without stopping and cause an accident. I have needed to swerve out of the way to avoid a car that misjudged where to stop at this junction more than once (on both occasions I was travelling from the Kilkenny Pub direction towards Andoversford).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: There are 2 potholes on Coltham Road at the junction with Strickland Road, 17th July
item.description:
There are 2 potholes on Coltham Road at the junction with Strickland Road. They are quite deep - one has plants growing in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Coltham Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 17th July
item.description:
Customer reported pothole 1ft x 1ft pothole. 3 inches deep
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead street tree, 17th July
item.description:
The Rowan tree on the corner of Hungerford St and St Paul’s Road appears to be dead. Please can it be replaced with another street tree over winter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The roadworks were not advertised, 17th July
item.description:
On the roundabout as shown on map. No issue ahead of the works to notify these were happening and no warning ahead of the roadworks they were even their. I missed an urgent GP appointment (suspected cancer) because of these roadworks. Then took me as long to get home. I have a disability so this was an issue. 4 way roadworks on a roundabout for the a46 was poor judgement without notification first (nothing on highways). The work was not even on the road itself a mnd this follows numerous roadworks in the vicinity.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: TMC - Defects - Signs & Street Furniture problem, 17th July

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Third and final bollard on pavement has been knocked down, 17th July
item.description:
The third and final bollard outside 50 Hall Road has now been knocked over. The other two bollards which have been knocked over in the same place have not been replaced so people park increasingly dangerously on the blind corner. Please could the bollards be replaced to stop people parking “just for 2 seconds” when they are dropping off their kids as it will inevitably cause an accident eventually. The fact all three bollards have been knocked over in such a short period just shows how dangerously people drive on Hall Road at school rush times. The bollards could very easily have been my children standing on the pavement outside our house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Hall Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
